instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
Hi, 
i have this board, i have a green led with an original 85W magsafe2, the green led shutdown after 5 sec and come back after some seconds.
With a PSU, the led stay green and become orange. No liquid damage, the customer put a bad power supply on this mac.
i can't verify voltage with the original pw adapter.
i find a bad <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> 40K instead of 20ohm, i change it but same problem.
The mac work on battery charged.
I don't know where i check, can you help me please?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
Usually leakage on <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages with original charger.
Also post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>, measured onboard.
Check <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> if short, or open.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>= 5,6Kohm
pin 5-6= 17V but not stay.
pin 1-2-3=17 but not stay
i change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> & <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>? <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> too?
<DIODE>D7010</DIODE> seems good (0,78V & 0L other way).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>= 5,6Kohm"
Leakage for sure.
Start changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> is not corroded...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
ok i try tomorrow to change it and i tell you after.
i don't understand and you can explain me, why the original charger stop to send the power? the mac talk with the charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
Because original charger is "smart" enough.
It has an embedded processor, which first needs to properly detect the expected board!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led 5 sec and shut down
threads.message:
hi  2informaticos, I change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> became at 68K.
The green led stay with original charger, repair done, thanks a lot.
